Job Description:
Definir, desarrollar e identificar la técnica particular, relación entre variables, desarrollo del código del modelo, optimización de la solución y algoritmos usando analítica descriptiva y prescriptiva a fin de garantizar el funcionamiento de la solución matemática desarrollada, la escalabilidad y repetibidad de las soluciones y mejoras operacionales tangibles de acuerdo a políticas, procedimientos y lineamientos del CDO.

En Banco Pichincha nos estamos transformando; por eso, queremos incorporar el mejor talento a nuestro equipo. Buscamos profesionales amantes de la innovación, la tecnología y el mundo digital que estén dispuestos a asumir nuevos desafíos. Nuestros 116 años de trayectoria nos ratifican que contar con personas comprometidas y con un alto desempeño es imprescindible para lograr nuestros objetivos. ¡Tú puedes ser el próximo! El esfuerzo, la responsabilidad, la coherencia y la trascendencia son valores que marcan la labor diaria de los 5.400 colaboradores que formamos parte de la mayor institución financiera del país. Empezamos a escribir la primera página de nuestra historia en 1906. Hoy contamos con filiales en seis países. En cada uno de esos mercados, defendemos la idea de una banca con propósito porque la tecnología, por sí misma, no es suficiente para favorecer la inclusión financiera. Nuestro liderazgo se afianza más en el nuevo humanismo y la ética empresarial, dos principios que contribuyen a mejorar la vida de nuestros clientes y a aportar al desarrollo de la sociedad.

Requisitos

EDUCACIÓN Título en áreas con un alto componente analítico (Economía, Estadística, Ingeniería Matemática o afines) o en Ingeniería de Sistemas De Preferencia máster en áreas como Data Science, Computer Science, Econometrics, Artificial Intelligence o afines EXPERIENCIA Modelación analítica (modelos predictivos o prescriptivos) Manejo de Big Data (grandes volúmenes de datos) Concursos CONOCIMIENTO Programación orientada a objetos Agrupar, ordenar y analizar grandes bases de datos (Big Data) vía SQL/MemSQL/Otros Entendimiento de matemáticas aplicadas, inteligencia artificial y operaciones matriciales Modelamiento de datos y entendimiento de diferentes estructuras de datos Software Open Source (R, Python, Jupyter, Anaconda, Mongo DB) Modelos estadísticos y econométricos (teoría y aplicaciones) Métricas de evaluación estadística/econométrica

Beneficios

Te ofrecemos un sin número de oportunidades para poner en práctica tu conocimiento, proponer ideas nuevas y diferentes en una institución que se transforma en beneficio de sus clientes y colaboradores. Contamos con un atractivo paquete salarial con beneficios monetarios y no monetarios, entre ellos capacitaciones constantes que te ayudarán a desarrollar tus habilidades esenciales y conocimiento técnico. Si cumples con todos los requisitos, esperamos tu postulación. Nos encantará acompañarte en tu crecimiento profesional. ¡Súmate a este nuevo desafío!

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s animal nutrition and health business, where we improve lives through better nutrition. Our team researches, innovates and creates solutions that deliver healthy results for our customers.
Job Purpose and Impact
The Research Scientist II will apply innovative technology to help drive the development of new products and improved processes for the food, feed and industrial segments. In this role, you will support the team and provide analytical knowledge to generate and analyze critical data. Key Accountabilities

May present ongoing work and findings to external audiences at conferences including the summaries and the nature and methodology of the research.
Identify and resolve first line troubleshooting analytical instrumentation.
Execute sample loading, processing and chromatographic trouble shooting prior to effectively communicate results to diverse scientific teams.
Conduct analytical samples, experiments following standards including the proposal disposal of wastes according to environmental health and safety guidelines in a high safety focused environment.
Build and conduct scientific experiments and process and analyze results of experiments and records data.
Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of two years of related work experience
Advanced english Preferred Qualifications Beginning-to-working knowledge of research techniques Experience in shrimp nutrition or production One or more year of related work experience

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s animal nutrition and health business, where we improve lives through better nutrition. Our team researches, innovates and creates solutions that deliver healthy results for our customers.
Job Purpose and Impact

Are you looking for opportunity to give to state-of-the-art scientific research? Join our team as a Senior Scientist , a key member of Cargill Aqua Nutrition (CQN) R&D team, where you will be responsible for innovating shrimp nutrition technology to help drive the development of shrimp projects and improved processes aligned with our CQN business objectives, generating value for our customers and preparing CQN pipeline for the future Key Accountabilities

Lead research projects and/or being a main contributor to projects delivering an offering or capability from exploring to implementation, including defining scope, organizing resources, and delivering a research project on time.
Work closely with R&D director, technology application leader to generate research trial pipeline which fits business needs and overall global shrimp research strategy
Designing, supervising and managing research trials internally and externally with scientific expertise and methodology to validate research hypothesis and innovate new solutions.
Work closely with trail leaders at R&D center to ensure research excellence with execution, and delivery research outcome which meets expectation.
Deliver scientific findings by preparing and presenting scientific works/reports/reviews both internally and externally Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Master’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Ability to communicate effectively with peers, supervisors, and managers
Confirmed working knowledge of scientific research principles, concepts, practices, and standards
Minimum of five years of related work experience
Ability to work with international/ regional/global teams independently Preferred Qualifications
PhDs in shrimp nutrition, shrimp health, or biological sciences plus 5+ years of research experience
Expertise with shrimp trial design, protocol and data analysis with different culture model and systems
Good understanding of scientific trial design fits into different culture model and country application
Knowledge of emerging technologies
Strong projects management and collaboration both internal and external parties
Strong analytical skill and high intellectual capacity, ability to deal with complexity and synthesize innovative solutions
Familiar with global mindset to connect and understand different countries requirements and cultures
Compelling and authentic communication, public presentation skills/engaging and approachable manner
Demonstrated disciplined approach to execution, successful experience in project management and scientific rigor
Agility to work across countries, globally in a virtual environment

BairesDev is the leading software development company in the Americas.
